description: From Middle English demoniak et al., from Old French demoniaque, from Late Latin daemoniacus.

adjectives.description: demoniac (comparative more demoniac, superlative most demoniac)

entries.meaning: Possessed or controlled by a demon.
Of or pertaining to demons; demonic.
examples: There was movement everywhere, screaming, demoniac activity; the old man was coming across the tumbling logs.

entries.meaning: Someone who is possessed by a demon.
examples: The exorcism was dropped from the second Edwardian Prayer Book, because of its implication that unbaptised infants were demoniacs [â€¦].
